Description: Spade currency. Spade-shaped iron with long handle.
Curator's comments: See John Petherick, Egypt, the Soudan and Central Africa, 1861, p.400: (on the Dor) ‘Possessing no cattle, their valuables consist in objects of iron, mostly in circular plates from nine inches to one foot in diameter, and long ornamented lance-like articles.’
Acquisition name: Exchanged with: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
Exchanged with: Royal United Service Institution (United Service Museum)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Royal United Service Institution (United Service Museum)
Acquisition notes: (slip) Brought from Central Africa by Mr John Petherick and obtained from him by the museum of the United Service Institute; obtained by Mr Franks from the latter by exchange 3 January 1873" when given by him to the BM.
